entry.title: Week 30, 2025: Performance issue reported for random scheduler in parallel tree operations
entry.content:
Summary

One issue opened reporting poor scaling performance in random scheduler

Activity

  • Gabriel Radanne opened scheduler performance issue reporting poor scaling behavior with the random scheduler on embarrassingly parallel workloads, specifically parallel tree map operations (#374)
entry.summary: Performance issue reported for random scheduler in parallel tree operations

entry.title: Week 29, 2025: One community discussion about fiber cancellation patterns in libcurl wrapper development
entry.summary: One community discussion about fiber cancellation patterns in libcurl wrapper development

entry.title: Week 25, 2025: None
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml-multicore/picos - Week 25, 2025

entry.title: Week 24, 2025: Benchmark optimization and condition variable implementation improvements by Vesa Karvonen
entry.content:
Summary

One new draft PR opened for condition variable improvements, with one benchmark optimization PR merged

Activity

  • New condition variable implementation opened as draft PR by Vesa Karvonen using counter-based approach instead of Awaitable enqueue for signal detection (#371)
  • Benchmark improvements merged with comprehensive refactoring of reference lock benchmarks, expanding from simple operations to include multiple operation types with inlined performance optimizations (#372)
entry.summary: Benchmark optimization and condition variable implementation improvements by Vesa Karvonen

entry.title: Week 23, 2025: Single architectural discussion about core building blocks
entry.summary: Single architectural discussion about core building blocks

entry.title: Week 22, 2025: None
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml-multicore/picos - Week 22, 2025

entry.title: Week 21, 2025: None
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml-multicore/picos - Week 21, 2025

entry.title: Week 20, 2025: Performance optimizations in bounded queue benchmarks and select wakeup logic by Vesa Karvonen
entry.content:
Summary

Major cleanup week with 4 experimental PRs closed and 4 performance-focused PRs merged

Activity

  • Performance-focused merges by Vesa Karvonen including bounded queue benchmark optimization (#368), select wakeup logic improvements (#367), semaphore-based bounded queue example (#369), and multififo scheduler benchmarking (#364)
  • Experimental work cleanup with closure of MPMC queue using cooperative pointer reversal (#350) due to high write barrier costs, shallow effects experiment (#208) due to performance regression, space usage tweaks (#300) to concentrate on structured Run operations, and bounded queue rewrite (#346) in favor of semaphore example
  • Ongoing development continues with bounded blocking Stack (#321) and structured Run operations (#334) remaining as draft PRs
entry.summary: Performance optimizations in bounded queue benchmarks and select wakeup logic by Vesa Karvonen

entry.title: Week 19, 2025: Benchmarking improvement to test queues with heap-allocated blocks instead of immediate values
entry.content:
Summary

Single PR merged improving benchmarking methodology for queue data structures

Activity

  • Benchmarking methodology improvement by Vesa Karvonen changing queue benchmarks from immediate values to heap-allocated blocks, better exposing write barrier overhead (#366)
entry.summary: Benchmarking improvement to test queues with heap-allocated blocks instead of immediate values

entry.title: Week 18, 2025: Major improvements to multififo scheduler with heartbeat-based worker wakeup and parameterized load balancing
entry.content:
Summary

Focus on multififo scheduler improvements with six merged PRs enhancing performance and fairness characteristics

Activity

  • Multififo scheduler enhancements dominated the week with Vesa Karvonen implementing heartbeat-based worker management (#362), parameterized heartbeat configuration (#363), and load balancing improvements (#358)
  • Memory optimization work delivered through lazy bundle trigger allocation (#360) and improved bundle representation by inlining atomic fields (#337)
  • Code cleanup and documentation updates including alert attribute positioning (#361) and benchmark prioritization of multififo scheduler (#364)
  • Work-in-progress PR for adding bind_on and await_on to Picos_lwt remains open for future development (#338)
entry.summary: Major improvements to multififo scheduler with heartbeat-based worker wakeup and parameterized load balancing

entry.title: Week 17, 2025: Major scheduler improvements and new guarded case statements implementation with comprehensive fairness testing
entry.content:
Summary

Comprehensive scheduler improvements focusing on fairness and testing infrastructure

Activity

  • Load balancing work completed with Vesa Karvonen implementing periodic stealing strategy for multififo scheduler to improve fairness across worker threads (#358)
  • Test infrastructure enhancements including verbose output capabilities and statistical fairness measurement framework for validating scheduler behavior (#359)
  • Example implementations demonstrating practical use of structured concurrency with guarded case statements inspired by cooperative threading research (#355)
  • Bug fixes addressing semaphore stress test failures on OCaml 5 by avoiding thread creation resource exhaustion (#354)
entry.summary: Major scheduler improvements and new guarded case statements implementation with comprehensive fairness testing

entry.title: Week 16, 2025: None
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml-multicore/picos - Week 16, 2025

entry.title: Week 15, 2025: Reported threading issue in semaphore stress test with thread-based scheduler on OCaml 5
entry.content:
Summary

Testing issue reported regarding thread creation resource limits in stress tests

Activity

  • Thread creation issue reported by Vesa Karvonen in semaphore stress test where the test spawns too many threads causing "Resource temporarily unavailable" errors with the thread-based scheduler on OCaml 5 (#353)
entry.summary: Reported threading issue in semaphore stress test with thread-based scheduler on OCaml 5

entry.title: Week 14, 2025: Added systhread-based scheduler testing on OCaml 5 to improve test coverage across different scheduler implementations
entry.content:
Summary

Single focused PR merged to expand scheduler testing capabilities for better OCaml 5 compatibility verification

Activity

  • Test infrastructure improvements completed with Vesa Karvonen merging changes to add systhread-based scheduler testing on OCaml 5 (#352)
  • Scheduler coverage expansion implemented by modifying the test scheduler to randomly select from 5 different scheduler types instead of 4, ensuring the new picos_mux.thread scheduler gets tested alongside existing options
entry.summary: Added systhread-based scheduler testing on OCaml 5 to improve test coverage across different scheduler implementations

entry.title: Week 8, 2025: None
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml-multicore/picos - Week 8, 2025

entry.title: Week 7, 2025: New poisonable Barrier synchronization primitive added to picos_std.sync with slim implementation
entry.content:
Summary

Single PR merged implementing new Barrier primitive with comprehensive tests and documentation updates

Activity

  • Barrier implementation completed by Vesa Karvonen with full feature set including poisoning mechanism, party configuration, and test suite (#351)
  • Documentation improvements including API documentation for new Barrier module and typo fix in existing doc comments (#351)
entry.summary: New poisonable Barrier synchronization primitive added to picos_std.sync with slim implementation

entry.title: Week 6, 2025: Test code improvements and new MPMC queue draft PR activity
entry.content:
Summary

New draft PR for MPMC queue implementation using cooperative pointer reversal

Activity

  • New draft PR opened by Vesa Karvonen for MPMC queue implementation using cooperative pointer reversal technique (#350)
entry.summary: Test code improvements and new MPMC queue draft PR activity

entry.title: Week 5, 2025: Hash table functionality enhancements and internal optimizations by Vesa Karvonen
entry.content:
Summary

Hash table module improvements with three merged PRs focusing on performance and functionality

Activity

  • Hash table enhancements completed with three focused PRs by Vesa Karvonen including copy functionality (#349), relaxed size reading (#348), and allocation guarantees (#347)
  • Internal optimizations delivered through mutable field usage ensuring unique block allocation and improved contention handling
  • API expansion with new copy function adding 62 lines of implementation and comprehensive test coverage
  • Documentation improvements clarifying termination semantics in structured concurrency constructs
entry.summary: Hash table functionality enhancements and internal optimizations by Vesa Karvonen

entry.title: Week 4, 2025: Major synchronization primitives expansion with new Lock, Rwlock, and Sem implementations by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic)
entry.content:
Summary

Single contributor focused week with one draft PR opened and five major synchronization primitive PRs merged

Activity

  • Draft PR opened: Rewrite of Bounded_q bench using Sem by Vesa Karvonen to demonstrate the new semaphore implementation (#346)
  • Major synchronization primitives delivery: Vesa Karvonen completed implementation of three new core synchronization types with comprehensive APIs, condition variable support, and expert-level interfaces (#341, #344, #345)
  • Testing infrastructure enhancement: QCheck STM upgrade enables better testing patterns for blocking data structures with wrap_cmd_seq support (#342)
  • Performance optimization work: Awaitable API extension with fenceless_get function for specialized use cases (#343)
  • Benchmarking improvements: Comprehensive benchmark suite restructuring with new lock and reference operation benchmarks while removing outdated mutex and semaphore tests
entry.summary: Major synchronization primitives expansion with new Lock, Rwlock, and Sem implementations by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic)

entry.title: Week 3, 2025: New QCheck STM PR opened by Vesa Karvonen for better blocking data structure testing, with ongoing Rwlock development discussions
entry.content:
Summary

QCheck STM upgrade PR opened and Rwlock development discussions continued

Activity

  • QCheck STM upgrade opened by Vesa Karvonen to support wrap_cmd_seq for better testing of blocking data structures (#342)
  • Rwlock implementation continued development with Jan Midtgaard providing feedback on the ongoing work (#341)
entry.summary: New QCheck STM PR opened by Vesa Karvonen for better blocking data structure testing, with ongoing Rwlock development discussions

entry.title: Week 2, 2025: Infrastructure improvements with OCaml 5.3 support and new Rwlock feature opening
entry.content:
Summary

New Rwlock implementation opened for future development with significant code additions

Activity

  • New Rwlock feature opened by Vesa Karvonen introducing low overhead read-write locks with associated condition variables using the Awaitable abstraction (#341)
  • OCaml 5.3 integration completed by Vesa Karvonen with immediate merge after testing (#340)
entry.summary: Infrastructure improvements with OCaml 5.3 support and new Rwlock feature opening

entry.title: Week 1, 2025: None
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml-multicore/picos - Week 1, 2025

entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml-multicore/picos - Week 51, 2024

entry.title: Week 50, 2024: OCamlformat upgrade to 0.27.0 reformatted entire codebase and new Lwt integration PR opened
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened for Lwt integration while several draft PRs remain in development

Activity

  • New Lwt integration PR opened by Vesa Karvonen adding bindon and awaiton functions to Picos_lwt (#338)
  • Development tooling improved with OCamlformat upgrade merged by Vesa Karvonen affecting 32 files across the entire codebase (#339)
  • Ongoing draft work continues across multiple areas including CML-style channels (#164), Per_thread caching (#214), and performance improvements (#307)
entry.summary: OCamlformat upgrade to 0.27.0 reformatted entire codebase and new Lwt integration PR opened

entry.title: Week 49, 2024: None
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml-multicore/picos - Week 49, 2024

entry.title: Week 48, 2024: Maintenance week focused on fixing js_of_ocaml compatibility and upgrading cohttp dependency to stable release
entry.content:
Summary

Three PRs merged addressing compatibility issues plus one draft PR for structured Run operations

Activity

  • Draft PR opened for structured Run operations by Vesa Karvonen with significant API additions (#334)
  • jsofocaml compatibility restored through fix for caml_ml_domain_id reference issue reported by @hhugo and resolved by Vesa Karvonen (#332, #333)
  • Cohttp dependency upgrade completed from beta to stable 6.0.0 release with corresponding API adjustments (#335)
  • OpenBSD compatibility PR closed as no longer needed due to OCaml-CI infrastructure improvements (#331)
entry.summary: Maintenance week focused on fixing js_of_ocaml compatibility and upgrading cohttp dependency to stable release

entry.title: Week 47, 2024: Fix for js_of_ocaml compatibility issue affecting OCaml 4 and typo correction in documentation
entry.content:
Summary

Two PRs opened addressing jsofocaml compatibility and OpenBSD dependency issues

Activity

  • New draft PR opened by Vesa Karvonen addressing OpenBSD compatibility issues with cohttp dependencies (#331)
  • Compatibility fix implemented for jsofocaml breaking changes affecting picos.thread on OCaml 4, with PR merged after community discussion (#333)
entry.summary: Fix for js_of_ocaml compatibility issue affecting OCaml 4 and typo correction in documentation

entry.title: Week 46, 2024: Enhanced Spawn effect specification for fiber cancelation handling and minor documentation improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Single PR merged enhancing Spawn effect specification with detailed review discussion on cancelation semantics

Activity

  • Spawn effect specification enhancement merged by Vesa Karvonen with comprehensive clarification of fiber cancelation behavior during spawn operations (#330)
  • Multiple documentation fixes committed throughout the week including grammar corrections and typo fixes across interface files (f8ab869, 05fc7f7, 9f446e7)
entry.summary: Enhanced Spawn effect specification for fiber cancelation handling and minor documentation improvements

entry.title: Week 45, 2024: Three merged PRs by Vesa Karvonen adding lock-free data structure examples and optimizing reference counting memory usage
entry.content:
Summary

Focused development week with three sequential merges implementing lock-free data structure examples and memory optimizations

Activity

  • Lock-free data structure examples completed through sequential implementation by Vesa Karvonen starting with randomized bag (#327), followed by reference counting optimization (#328), and comprehensive documentation (#329)
  • Memory efficiency improvements delivered through simplified external reference counting logic removing atomic indirection and leveraging new hash table operations (#328)
entry.summary: Three merged PRs by Vesa Karvonen adding lock-free data structure examples and optimizing reference counting memory usage

entry.title: Week 44, 2024: Major 0.6.0 release with refined Awaitable abstraction, optimizations, and branding updates
entry.content:
Summary

Single open PR for bounded blocking Stack and preparation for 0.6.0 release with comprehensive branding updates

Activity

  • New bounded blocking Stack implementation opened by Vesa Karvonen as draft PR with 167 additions across 6 files (#321)
  • Version 0.6.0 release preparation and execution by Vesa Karvonen including release notes compilation (#322), version number updates, and final Awaitable abstraction refinements (#320)
  • Project branding completed with addition of PICOS logo design (#325) and subsequent color adjustments (#326), plus documentation integration
entry.summary: Major 0.6.0 release with refined Awaitable abstraction, optimizations, and branding updates

entry.title: Week 43, 2024: Documentation improvements and awaitable abstraction refinements
entry.content:
Summary

Two PRs merged by Vesa Karvonen focusing on documentation fixes and awaitable improvements

Activity

  • Documentation refinements completed with Vesa Karvonen merging two PRs: refined Awaitable abstraction (#320) and fixed Fiber.FLS.create documentation (#319)
  • Awaitable atomic locations feature merged from previous week (#314) introducing futex-like abstraction for implementing synchronization primitives with performance improvements
  • Five commits delivered during the week focusing entirely on documentation clarity, grammar fixes, and example code simplification
entry.summary: Documentation improvements and awaitable abstraction refinements

entry.title: Week 42, 2024: Ten PRs merged focusing on performance optimizations and hash table enhancements
entry.content:
Summary

Single contributor focused on performance optimizations and platform consistency improvements

Activity

  • Performance optimization series delivered through multiple PRs by Vesa Karvonen including fast path tweaks for computation waiting/peeking (#310), stack usage reduction (#311, #312), and inlining improvements (#309)
  • External dependency integration with removal of internal Countdown implementation in favor of using version from multicore-bench library (#316)
  • Experimental performance work exploring CPU relaxation during yielding to reduce contention, though this approach was closed without merging after showing no measurable effect (#303)
entry.summary: Ten PRs merged focusing on performance optimizations and hash table enhancements
